div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 1638 Delta, 1887 (362) Burial: c. 500 B.C. (Jenkins) Contents: 30 AR Mende: 2 tetradr. Neapolis Maced.: 1 st. Sermyle: 1 tetradr. Thraco-Maced.: 1 st. (flowers) Lete: 1 st. Dicaea Thraciae: 1 st. Thasos: 1 st. Athens: 3 tetradr. Corinth: 1 st. Cyzicus: 1 fr. Miletus: 6 fr. Chios: 1 st. Samos: 1 fr. Cos: 1 fr. Lycia: 1 fr. Salamis: 2 st. Tyre: 2 fr. Unc.: 1 st. (sea-urchin? cf. ZfN 1927, p. 101) 2 fr. (gorgon/harpy 1, ape? 1) Disposition: London 8 (NC 1890, pl. 1, 1, 7, 8, 16, 19; pl. 2, 6-8); Boston 2 (Brett 545-6); Weber 9 (2353, 2499, 5028, 6245, 6288, 6620, 7713, 8083, 8551) † Greenwell, NC 1890, pp. 1-12, illus. † Dressel, ZfN 1900, pp. 255-8 Schlumberger, L'argent grec, p. 10, no. 31 Barron, Samos, pp. 30-1 (Tyre specimens in- trusive)
